Sounds go=
od if you can insure the "Secret' ... Please remember that I'm a Magician/M=
entalist and I've utilized similar procedures in a Deceptive manner. But if=
 you can assure no "Hanky Panky" it is a fantastic idea!!!!
I once did some=
thing similar with three boxes. Only about 30 or so people guessed. One fel=
low hit one directly and said one of the other boxes was empty .. and it wa=
s !!!! (But he guesses the wrong one... Still, with millions of things it c=
ould have been... Very Interesting !!! All on the up and up.
Keep up the go=
od work.


On Fri, Jul 16, 2010 at 3:42 PM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:=



=C2=A0 







I am=C2=A0 hesitant to reveal the answer to anyone before=
 the end of the test, since that would call into question a possible 'leak'=
.=C2=A0 

But I have loaded a mac version of the file up now, which doesn't=
 use any self-extracting extra applications: just the disk imaging built in=
to the OS.=C2=A0 I'll look into doing the same with Windows, so there is no=
 worry about any apps in the zip file.

=C2=A0 

This is AWESOME!!!!
W=
e did several experiments like this on the Magic Cafe and the results were =
amazing. However, I would request that you contact one member on the board =
and tell them the real answer. If the zip file carries any applications it =
can not be trusted unfortunately.
I think this can be very exciting and fun=
 too!!!!
Dave
THE MAN THE SKEPTICS REFUSED TO TEST FOR A MILLION DOLLARS.

=

On Fri, Jul 16, 2010 at 2:28 PM, rasterer <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=
=C2=A0 



Experiment 2

On Friday, 7/16/2010 I placed an object on top of =
my computer monitor, right in front of me, and will leave it there until no=
on Denver time on Monday, 7/19/2010. This experiment asks for participants =
to determine what that object is. Vague or partial answers won't be counted=
 (for example, just giving a color, shape, size, what it's made of, etc): w=
e're looking for what it is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Monday won't=
 count. Participants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other=
 means they chose. At the end of the experiment, I will reveal the object, =
and a tally of the number of correct and/or incorrect answers.

In order to=
 keep me honest, I have taken a picture of the object at the start of the e=
xperiment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder) of this group. The=
 idea with this file is that you can download it now and 'keep it safe' on =
your computer. Then at the end of the experiment, I will post the password =
so you can reveal the contents of the file. That way, you were in control o=
f the original image during the entire test, not me. If you can follow the =
link, it is here:

Windows users: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ EVP=
-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. win.zip

Mac users: http://tech. groups.yahoo. c=
om/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. mac.zip

And if you do not care to =
download the zip file now, I will post the final image there at the end of =
the experiment anyway.

My monitor is one of the older box-like SONY CRTs, =
and says "Trinitron" and "Multiscan 200sf" on the upper front. I have a cou=
ple monitors stacked in my closet too: they are not the monitors used in th=
is experiment (and have nothing else on them anyway), and I have several la=
ptops around: they are also not the monitors in this experiment. The monito=
r in this experiment is the only SONY monitor I have, says "SONY in various=
 places on it, can be seen in the following link from the first experiment,=
 when the correct answer would have been "radio":

http://tech. groups.yaho=
o. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 1.JPG

Please post all answers=
 to the group thread: that way, there will be a public record and I won't g=
et accused of losing any answers. 

And best of luck to all the participant=
s!
